oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Elizabeth MB Church and Lodge: old and new buildings
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Elizabeth Missionary Baptist Church, Lodge, and Cemetery

Color photograph of a two-story weathered wood building with gable roof and stone chimney; building has five visible windows, four of which are on the side; in the foreground next to the building is a white church steeple laying on its side, square base with a tall peak; white two story church with a one-story porch and gable roof visible in background

This historic congregation and meeting place dates to the spring of 1865 when Josiah Murray, a local landowner, gave lands to his emancipated slaves for a church and cemetery. The present church building dates to the late 20th century but the historic lodge/school dates to the late 19th-early 20th century.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; African American schools -- Tennessee;
Churches; Steeples
